body:
### Rationale

With over 5k packages navigating the builtin repo is quite cumbersome, specifically through the GitHub UI:

>  Sorry, we had to truncate this directory to 1,000 files. 4,582 entries were omitted from the list. 

### Description

Some package managers choose to create subdirs for the first letter:

``a/ b/ c/ ... z/``

Or even

```aa/ ab/ ac/ ... ba/ bb/ ... zz/```

Or

```a/a/ a/b/ ... z/z/```

That would make browsing through github a bit easier.
title: Restructure repo
